page.title: 08Conservation - Olton Mere
page.content: Oltone Mere, previously called Olton Reservoir, is owned by British Waterways and is a conservation area. Many species of fish and water birds inhabit the lake, while the surrounding woods with their dense undergrowth, streams and bog, provide rare breeding grounds for creatures under pressure such as the frog. When trees fall they are left to decay naturally, soon becoming home for many species of insect and fungus. Olton Mere is a man made lake, said to have been dug out by Napoleonic prisoners of war around 1795. There were however, 20000 Irish navies there at the time building the canal. The Mere was made waterproof by puddling. Mixing a paste of clay, sand and water and treading it down in layers. A private sailing club uses the lake but their chief concern is conservation.
